Sentencas: This paper presents a unique demonstration of anode barrier-layer technology in a tubular solid-oxide fuel cell (SOFC) architecture.
Titulo: Use of anode barrier layers in tubular solid-oxide fuel cells for robust operation on hydrocarbon fuels

Sentencas: The anode barrier layer is a chemically inert, porous ceramic tube that is positioned within the inside diameter of the tubular SOFC, separating the catalytically active anode from the hydrocarbon-carrying fuel stream.
Titulo: Use of anode barrier layers in tubular solid-oxide fuel cells for robust operation on hydrocarbon fuels

Sentencas: This porous tube reduces the respective diffusion rates of reactants and products into and out of the anode.
Titulo: Use of anode barrier layers in tubular solid-oxide fuel cells for robust operation on hydrocarbon fuels

Sentencas: This increases the local concentration of electrochemically produced steam and carbon dioxide throughout the anode, resulting in higher local steam-to-carbon ratios that enhance the selectivity of internal-reforming reactions toward hydrogen and carbon monoxide over the formation of deleterious carbon deposits.
Titulo: Use of anode barrier layers in tubular solid-oxide fuel cells for robust operation on hydrocarbon fuels

Sentencas: In this study, stable electrochemical performance is demonstrated under a simulated biogas fuel stream (63% CH4/34% CO2/3% H2O) over 12 days of continuous operation.
Titulo: Use of anode barrier layers in tubular solid-oxide fuel cells for robust operation on hydrocarbon fuels

Sentencas: The performance of the barrier layer-equipped SOFC is characterized under biogas and hydrogen fuels, and compared to the performance of an SOFC without a barrier layer.
Titulo: Use of anode barrier layers in tubular solid-oxide fuel cells for robust operation on hydrocarbon fuels

Sentencas: While some decrease in power density is evident with the presence of a barrier layer, the performance decrease at 0.7V is modest.
Titulo: Use of anode barrier layers in tubular solid-oxide fuel cells for robust operation on hydrocarbon fuels

Sentencas: Morphological characterization after performance testing reveals no evidence of carbon deposition within the anode or barrier layer.
Titulo: Use of anode barrier layers in tubular solid-oxide fuel cells for robust operation on hydrocarbon fuels

Sentencas: These results demonstrate the potential of barrier-layer technology in tubular solid-oxide fuel cell architectures.
Titulo: Use of anode barrier layers in tubular solid-oxide fuel cells for robust operation on hydrocarbon fuels
